Class ElevationGrid

Builds one elevation grid chunk. It can consists of several elevation grids to be used in a LOD. For every appearance in the appearances parameter one level is built with 25% size of the last level.
Defined in: ElevationGrid.js.

Class Summary
Constructor Attributes Constructor Name and Description
 
ElevationGrid(parentNode, info, hf, appearances)

Shrinks the heightfield with the given factor
Class Detail
ElevationGrid(parentNode, info, hf, appearances)
Parameters:
parentNode
- Dom element to append the elevation grids to.
info
- Information about the ID,position of the chunk, the height map's size and the modelIndex.
hf
- The height map to be used for the elevation grid.
appearances
- Array of appearances. For every appearance one level for LOD is built. 1 Level = no LOD.
Method Detail
<inner> {HTMLElement} calcTexCoords(xpos, ypos, sizex, sizey, terrainWidth, terrainHeight, shrinkfactor)
Calcs the TextureCoordinates for the elevation grid(s). Use the values of the full/most detailed version if using for LOD and adjust only the shrinkfactor parameter.
Parameters:
xpos
- Start position of the elevation grid within the terrain.
ypos
- Start position of the elevation grid within the terrain.
sizex
- Size of the elevation grid on the x-Axis.
sizey
- Size of the elevation grid on the x-Axis.
terrainWidth
- Size of the whole terrain on the x-Axis.
terrainHeight
- Size of the whole terrain on the y-Axis.
shrinkfactor
- The factor the heightmap this TextureCoordinates are was shrunk.
Returns:
{HTMLElement} - X3DOM TextureCoordinate Node.
<inner> setupChunk()
Creates and inserts elevation grid (terrain chunk) into the DOM.
<inner> {string} shrinkHeightMap(heightfield, sizex, sizey, shrinkfactor)
Shrinks the heightfield with the given factor
Parameters:
heightfield
- The used heihgfield.
sizex
- Width of the heightfield.
sizey
- Height of the heightfield.
shrinkfactor
- Factor to shrink the heightmap. 1:Full heightmap 2: 25% (scaled 50% on each side)
Returns:
{string}
